afterSetup.title: Secure your backup
afterSetup.removeSdCard: Remove the SD Card from your BitBox02 to continue.
afterSetup.instructions1: Keep your {{backup}} in a secure place, where only you can access.
afterSetup.understand1: You are the only one responsible of the storage of your {{backup}}.
afterSetup.understand2: Losing your {{backup}} or a thief accessing it will result in a loss of funds.
afterSetup.understand3: Nobody can help to recover your funds if you lose your {{backup}}, not even Swiss Bitcoin Pay.

afterUpgrade.title: Open your BitBox02
afterUpgrade.instruction: Touch one of the 2 sides marked "Tap this side"

bootloader.title: Installing the firmware
bootloader.instruction1: We are installing the official firmware in your BitBox02
bootloader.instruction2: Do not remove the BitBox02 from your device

connect.title: Connect your {{hardwareWallet}}
connect.updateBitbox: Make sure your BitBox02 have a firmware installed

connected.title: Unlock
connected.instruction: Enter BitBox02 password to unlock it

pairing.title: Verify pairing code
pairing.instruction: Verify that the following pairing code is the same as displayed on your BitBox02:
pairing.confirm1: If the codes are the same, confirm it by pressing
pairing.confirm2: on the side of your BitBox02

setup.title: Setup your wallet
setup.instruction1: How would you like to backup your BitBox02's wallet?
setup.insertSdCard: Please insert the SD card in your BitBox02
setup.setPassword1: Please set a password on your BitBox02.
setup.setPassword2: This password will be used to unlock it every time you use it.
setup.confirmName1: Confirm the device name by pressing
setup.confirmName2: on the side of your BitBox02
setup.uninitBitboxNoWeb: Uninitlialized BitBox02 are not supported on web. Please setup your wallet using the official BitBoxApp

signature.title: Signature
signature.selectAccount: Select the account you want to use
signature.waitingForSignature: Please sign the message on your {{hardwareWallet}}
signature.bitcoinAppNotOpened: Please open the Bitcoin app on your wallet and try again
signature.signatureError: Error signing message. Please try again

step1.instructions1: Owning a bitcoin wallet means you are solely responsible for it.
step1.instructions2: Take a moment to read carefully this short introduction to understand what it really means, otherwise it might increase the risk of your funds being lost or stolen.
step1.instructions3: Please note that if this were to happen, no one will be able to help recovering your funds, even Swiss Bitcoin Pay.
step1.instructions4: We store no copy of your wallet keys or your funds. We cannot access it or recover it. You are the only one responsible of the security of your wallet.

step2.instructions1: In the next step, we'll display your 12 words (also called seed phrase). This secret seed phrase is the only way to access your bitcoins.
step2.instructions2: Your seed phrase is generated securely and localy on your device, and is never sent to our servers.
step2.instructions3: Write it down on a durable medium and keep it in a secure place.
step2.instructions4: If you lose your seed phrase, your funds will be lost forever. It is therefore absolutely critical to properly store and protect your seed phrase.
step2.agree1: I understand that I am the only one responsible of the storage of my seed phrase.
step2.agree2: I understand that losing my seed phrase or a thief seeing it will result in a loss of funds.
step2.agree3: I understand that nobody can help to recover my funds if I lose my seed phrase, not even Swiss Bitcoin Pay.

step3.instructions1: Write down your 12 words and make sure it is clearly readable.
step3.instructions2: Please make sure to respect the words order!
step3.instructions3: This seed phrase was generated from 100% open-source code and is never leaving your device.

step5.instructions2: Store your seed phrase in a safe place, and never show it to anyone!

errors.serverInMaintenance: Server in maintenance. Please try again later
errors.noKycLimit: You have reached the non-KYC limit
errors.accountNotVerified: Verify your deposit address on your dashboard

emailLogin.title: Email login
emailLogin.emailInvalid: Please provide a valid email address

invoice.invoiceQr: Access this invoice on another device by scanning this QR code
invoice.payTheRest: Pay the rest ({{sats}} sats) via Lightning or Onchain
invoice.scanToYourPhone: Scan to access this page on your phone
invoice.scanToPayIn: Scan to pay in Bitcoin by

kyc.title: Identity verification
kyc.description: Due to regulations, we have to verify some informations about you. Please follow the steps below before paying the invoice.
kyc.pendingVerificationDescription: Your information and documents have been sent. We will review them manually and get back to you by e-mail within 24 working hours.

detailsData.depositsInstitutionName: Institution name where savings account is held
detailsData.savingsAcquirementDetails: Details of how the savings were acquired
detailsData.dividendLength: Length of time the shares have been held in the company
detailsData.giftPerson: Email of the person who gave the gift
detailsData.compensationPayoutDetails: Details of events leading to claim

documentsData.payslip: Payslip (or bonus payment slip) from the last three months
documentsData.employerLetter: Letter from employer confirming salary on letter-headed paper
documentsData.incomeBankStatement: Bank statement clearly showing receipt of most recent regular salary payments from named employer
documentsData.investmentSaleCertificate: Investment/savings certificates, contract notes, or surrender statements
documentsData.fundsBankStatement: Bank statements clearly showing receipt of funds and investment company name
documentsData.signedLetter: Signed letter detailing funds from a regulated accountant on letter-headed paper
documentsData.propertySaleSolicitorLetter: Letter from a licensed solicitor or regulated accountant stating property address, date of sale, proceeds received, and name of purchaser
documentsData.companySaleLetter: Letter detailing company sale signed by a licensed solicitor or regulated accountant on letter-headed paper
documentsData.companySaleBankStatement: Copy of bank statement showing proceeds
documentsData.companySaleMediaCoverage: Copies of media coverage (if applicable) as supporting evidence
documentsData.probateGrant: Grant of probate (with a copy of the will) which must include the value of estate
documentsData.willLetter: Copy of will letter from lawyer or trustee
documentsData.divorceSettlementLetter: Letter detailing divorce settlement signed by a licensed solicitor on letter-headed paper
documentsData.companyAccountsAudit: Copy of the latest audited company accounts
documentsData.companyActivityLetter: Confirmation of the nature of business activity and turnover detailed in a letter from a regulated accountant
documentsData.retirementBankStatementReceipt: Bank statement showing receipt of latest pension income and name of provider
documentsData.accountStartEvidence: Evidence of account start (letter from the account provider)
documentsData.dividendBankStatement: Bank statement clearly showing receipt of funds and name of company paying dividend
documentsData.dividendDetailsLetter: Letter detailing dividend details signed by a regulated accountant on letter-headed paper
documentsData.companyAccountsSet: Set of company accounts showing the dividend details
documentsData.donorLetter: Letter from donor confirming details of gift
documentsData.donorSourceOfWealth: Documented evidence of donor’s source of wealth
documentsData.loanAgreement: Copy of the loan agreement and details of any security
documentsData.insuranceLetter: Letter from insurance provider confirming payout

sourceOfFundData.income: Income – savings from salary (basic and/or bonus)
sourceOfFundData.investmentSale: Sale of investment / liquidation of investment portfolio

payoutConfig.title: Payout configuration
payoutConfig.iWantToReceive: I want to receive my funds...
payoutConfig.messageToSignDetails: Sign this message with the Bitcoin wallet you entered
payoutConfig.yourSignatureDetails: Signature you obtained from your wallet
payoutConfig.payInvoiceToCertify: Pay this 1 sat invoice to certify that you control your Lightning Address
payoutConfig.signWithAddressDetails: Sign the message with this Bitcoin address
payoutConfig.receiveInBtcDescription1: {{percent}}% of the bitcoins that you charge via Swiss Bitcoin Pay will be sent to the bitcoin wallet you provide.
payoutConfig.receiveInBtcDescription2: Lightning to Onchain conversions and miner fees are always free of charge for you.
payoutConfig.receiveInBtcDescription3: Payments to your wallet are made by default every 1st of the month. Minimum threshold is 1000 sats.
payoutConfig.receiveInBtcDescription3Lightning: Your bitcoins will be instantly sent to your lightning address after each payment. Make sure that your node is well connected.
payoutConfig.receiveInBtcDescription4: A cryptographic signature of your Bitcoin wallet is required to prove ownership.
payoutConfig.receiveInBankDescription1: {{percent}}% of the bitcoins that you charge via Swiss Bitcoin Pay will be sold for {{currency}} then sent automatically to your bank account through our partner
payoutConfig.receiveInBankDescription2Instant: The payment to your bank account is made automatically as soon as your balance exceeds the minimum of {{formattedAmount}}.
payoutConfig.receiveInBankDescription2Batched: The payment to your bank account is automatically done everyday at 0:00 UTC once your balance exceeds the minimum of {{formattedAmount}}.
payoutConfig.receiveInBankDescription2Swift: Swift transfers in {{currency}} are subject to Swift bank fees, which are not predictable and can represent {{formattedAmountLow}} to {{formattedAmountHigh}} additional fees.
payoutConfig.receiveInBankDescription3Swift: Payment into your bank account is made automatically every 1st of the month once your balance exceeds the minimum of {{formattedAmount}}.
payoutConfig.receiveInBankDescription3: Below this amount, it is also possible to manually trigger a transfer, for a fee of {{formattedAmount}}.
payoutConfig.receiveInBankDescriptionInstantSepa: If your bank is Instant SEPA compatible, you will receive your payments instantly into your bank account.
payoutConfig.receiveInBankDescriptionFasterPayments: The payment to your bank account in GBP is made instantly via Faster Payments.
payoutConfig.hardwareConnectSuccess: Your {{hardwareWallet}} has been connected sucessfully. You can disconnect it.
payoutConfig.patchSettingNeedsEmailValidation: Confirm the new settings via the email you received

pos.deviceNameDescription: You can define a custom name to identify this device on the dashboard

settings.title: Settings
settings.scanOtherColleagues: Other colleagues can scan to cash in for
settings.ticketsPrintingDescription: Payment receipts can be printed automatically after each invoice is paid
settings.merchantNameDescription: The merchant name is present in all invoices you and your employees generates
settings.currencyDescription: The default currency of your account
settings.currencyChangeWarning: You actually receive {{fiatPercent}}% of your payments in {{currency}}. If you change your account's currency, your next payments will be converted to this new currency.
settings.onchainAvailableDescription: Tick this box if you want the invoices generated by the app to also accept Onchain payments from clients (recommended)
settings.emailDescription: The email where you can receive notifications and important informations
settings.confirmLogoutDescription: After logout, you will need to re-scan the activation code or connect with credentials
settings.invitationText: Use my link to accept Bitcoin payments for {{merchantName}}:

signatureLogin.enter12wordsDescription1: Your 12 words will stay on your device, to sign a message to authenticate you.
signatureLogin.enter12wordsDescription2: Please make sure that you enter your seed phrase on a verified, open-source build.
signatureLogin.enter12wordsDescription3: Still, this connection method is not considered 100% safe, as your device is connected to the internet, and therefore vulnerable. We are not responsible for any loss caused by the use of this login method.

signup.title: Signup
signup.emailInvalid: Please provide a valid email address
signup.emailDescription: Will only be used to send you important informations about your account. Never shared to third parties.
signup.currencyDescription: The default currency of your Business
signup.referralCodeDescription: If someone brought you to Swiss Bitcoin Pay, please write their referral code here
signup.submitDescription1: By creating your account, you're accepting our
signup.errorDescription: Error while creating your account. Please try again later or contact us at hello@swiss-bitcoin-pay.ch

address.alreadyExists: This address is already used by another account

email.alreadyExists: This email is already used by another account

iban.blacklisted: The bank of this IBAN is blacklisted

referralCode.doesntExists: This referral code does not exists

wallet.title: Onchain wallet
wallet.receiveInfo:
Receive bitcoins directly to your local wallet with this unused address.
Payments received directly to this address are not tracked by Swiss Bitcoin Pay and therefore are not subject to fees and are not included in exports.

sendModal.sendInfo: Send funds from your self-custodial wallet to a Bitcoin address
sendModal.sendLastInfo: Your transaction is generated and broadcast entirely from your local device. No private information passes through Swiss Bitcoin Pay servers

secureWallet.instructions1: You do not depend on Swiss Bitcoin Pay to access your bitcoins, your {{backup}} can be used on any bitcoin wallet.
secureWallet.instructions2: Never make a copy in a cloud, on your phone, or computer. Any device connected to the internet is vulnerable!
secureWallet.instructions3: Never share your {{backup}} to anyone. Any person that access your {{backup}} will be able to steal all of your funds.
